author: Acn
title: Catalunya registra 73 morts atribuïbles a les altes temperatures durant el juliol
text:
Catalunya ha registrat 73 morts atribuïbles a les altes temperatures aquest juliol , segons dades del sistema de monitorització de la mortalitat diària per totes les causes ( MoMo ) de l' Institut Carlos III . Si ens fixem en les dades del global de l'any, des del mes de gener hi ha hagut 219 defuncions per aquestes mateixes causes.
El sistema recull dades des del 2020 i des de llavors s'ha comptabilitzat a Catalunya un excés de 19.745 defuncions per totes les causes i 1.655 morts atribuïbles a les temperatures. Prenent com a referència només aquestes últimes, el 2020 van ser 42, el 2021 100, el 2022 711 i el 2023 583.
Segons consta a l'informe del MoMo d'aquest dijous, a Catalunya al gener hi va haver 141 morts atribuïbles a les temperatures. Les altres es distribueixen amb tres al març, una a l'abril i 73 al juliol.
Els tres últims dies de juliol van ser els més càlids de com a mínim els darrers 20 anys Públic Les dades a l'Estat A l' Estat espanyol han estat 771 les defuncions atribuïbles a les temperatures al juliol i 1.758 en el conjunt de l'any. El 2020 hi va haver 2.152 morts per aquest motiu i des de llavors han pujat cada any: 3.550 el 2021, 5.876 el 2022 i 7.780 el 2023. Aquest any, el mes amb més defuncions ha estat juliol, tot i que al gener n'hi va haver 719. Al juny van ser 32, al maig 11, a l'abril 45, al març 82 i al febrer 98.

author: 小浪财讯
title: 红利ETF基金（159581）跌0.88%，半日成交额2414.50万元|基金_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月19日，截止午间收盘，红利ETF基金（159581）跌0.88%，报1.015元，成交额2414.50万元。红利ETF基金（159581）重仓股方面， 中远海控 截止午盘跌1.59%， 冀中能源 跌1.74%， 海澜之家 跌2.82%， 宁波华翔 涨0.19%， 山煤国际 跌1.03%， 唐山港 涨0.25%， 重庆百货 跌1.22%， 成都银行 跌0.64%， 山西焦煤 跌2.32%， 中谷物流 跌0.84%。
红利ETF基金（159581）业绩比较基准为 收益率，管理人为万家基金管理有限公司，基金经理为杨坤，成立（2024-03-06）以来回报为7.31%，近一个月回报为0.63%。

author: Miguel Paredes
title: 174 euros menos: uno de los mejores Samsung Galaxy que existen cae en picado
text: Queremos recomendarte un Samsung Galaxy, uno de los mejores terminales presentados por la firma coreana durante los últimos meses. El Samsung Galaxy S24 cae en picado, está a tu alcance con 174 euros de descuento en su versión más completa. Le que acompañan unos geniales 8 GB de memoria RAM y 256 GB de almacenamiento, no echarás nada en falta. Pero atento, que lo tentador no termina ahí. Por si no fuera suficiente, aquellos que pertenezcan a Amazon Prime no tendrán que pagar nada por el envío. Recibirás en la puerta de tu casa todo un gama alta capaz de competir con los mejores del panorama. No es solo una cara bonita, exígele el máximo y vuela cada día. Ver en Amazon.es: Samsung Galaxy S24 Compra el móvil de Samsung con descuento La pantalla de este Galaxy no te defraudará, llega con una diagonal de 6,2 pulgadas, tecnología AMOLED, resolución Full HD+ y 120 Hz de refresco. Es, sencillamente, una de las mejores que se pueden ver en el mercado Android. Derrocha color, nitidez y una fluidez que te enganchará desde el primer momento, no tenemos nada que reprochar al panel de nuestro protagonista. Samsung Exynos 2400 Pantalla de 6,2" AMOLED Full HD+ y 120 Hz 8 GB de RAM y 256 GB de memoria 3 cámaras traseras Batería de 4.000 mAh y carga de 25W NFC y 5G El Exynos 2400, uno de los procesadores creados por la misma Samsung, actúa como director de orquesta. No habrá juego o aplicación que no puedas disfrutar a máxima velocidad, te llevas una auténtica bestia capaz de todo. Como bien sabes, le acompañan unos interesantes 8 GB de RAM. En la bonita trasera del terminal asiático viven 3 sensores a las que podrás sacar mucho partido allá donde vayas. El móvil de Samsung demuestra un buen nivel con un sensor principal de 50 megapíxeles, un gran angular de 12 megapíxeles y una cámara para tus fotografías en modo retrato. Ver en Amazon.es: Samsung Galaxy S24 Lo has podido comprobar, el móvil de Samsung tiene todo lo que necesitas y más. Esos 174 euros de descuento lo hacen muy atractivo y le hacen competir de tú a tú con grandes exponentes de la gama alta. Si quieres algo potente, seguro y de fabricante tradicional, es una de las mejores compras.

author: The Bharat Express News
title: Northern lights will illuminate the sky Thursday, with another chance to see aurora in northern Minnesota on Friday
text:
MINNEAPOLIS — Minnesota saw a beautiful Northern Lights show Thursday night thanks to a geomagnetic storm that will continue Friday.
The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration’s Space Weather Prediction Center said a coronal mass ejection (CME) left the sun around 9 p.m. CST on Wednesday, traveling 2.5 million miles per hour to arrive on Earth after 10 a.m. Thursday.
Minnesotans from Linden Hills to Duluth could see the lights, which ranged in color from red to green to purple.
“This is a very fast CME. It’s the fastest CME we’ve actually measured to date that had a total Earth component in the solar cycle,” says space weather forecaster Shawn Dahl.
On Thursday, the storm was rated at a G4, meaning it was severe. The storm is rated G2, or moderate level, on Friday morning. The storm is expected to weaken as the day progresses, but Minnesotans living in the north will still be able to see some of the lights in the evening.
Dahl’s team says the storm “could impact ongoing recovery efforts for Hurricanes Helene and Milton” due to potential disruptions to communications satellites, high-frequency radio signals, GPS systems and power grids already strained by the massive storms.
Here you can see how the solar flare that hit Earth on Thursday morning left the sun on Wednesday evening
NOAA
NOAA has a spacecraft 1 million miles from Earth that alerts the prediction center when solar flares are between 15 and 30 minutes away from reaching our planet. Anyway, Predicting space storms is a pretty unpredictable science .
You can watch the storm’s activity in real time on the forecast center website.
Table of Contents
Toggle
Why do there seem to be more Northern Lights this year? More from CBS News Why do there seem to be more Northern Lights this year?
Bryan Brasher, the forecast center’s project manager, says we are at the peak of solar cycle 25, with each cycle lasting about eleven years. He says this cycle has been much more active than predicted.
All that activity has given Minnesotans plenty of opportunities to marvel at dancing light shows in the sky, with the most recent set of auroras visible in the Twin Cities and other parts of the state. this past weekend .
This current storm could even rival that of May produced incredible auroras over Minnesota but it is unclear whether it will be as strong or last as long.
The prediction center says CMEs are “massive explosions of solar and embedded magnetic fields.” When a CME hits and envelopes our planet’s magnetic field, the collision of its electrically charged particles with our atmosphere can cause blinding waves of color in the sky.
Check this one out tips from the pros about photographing the Northern Lights.
Northern Lights in Minnesota: October 10, 2024
20 photos
More from CBS News
Stefan Swanson
Stephen Swanson is a web producer at CBS Minnesota. Stephen, a 21-year WCCO-TV veteran, served as a floor director for a decade before moving to the newsroom, where he focuses on general assignment reporting.

author: Canadian Press
title: Another death reported since 2021 recall of home bed assist handles: Health Canada
text:
OTTAWA — Health Canada is reminding Canadians about a recall of home bed assist handles after learning of an additional death.
Four models of bed handles distributed by Drive Medical were first recalled two years ago after two reported deaths — one in Canada and one in the U.S.
Health Canada says as of Dec. 19, the company has received a report of a second death in this country.
The metal handles are affixed alongside the mattress to help people get in and out of their regular bed at home. The products are not designed for hospital beds.
Health Canada says more than 68,000 of the affected handles were sold between 2016 and 2021 in Canada.
It says consumers should stop using them and contact Drive Medical Canada to get a refund.
The recalled home bed assist model numbers are 15064, 15062, RTL15073 and RTL15063-ADJ.
No information has been provided about what caused any of the deaths, but the recall notice says that retention straps were not properly secured in the initial cases in Canada and the U.S.
Drive Medical has also learned of an additional three deaths in the U.S. that happened before Dec. 6, 2021, when the recall was first issued.
More than 496,000 of the bed assist products were distributed in the U.S. between 2007 and 2021. The products were sold on Amazon.
This report by The Canadian Press was first published Dec. 28, 2023.
Canadian Press health coverage receives support through a partnership with the Canadian Medical Association. CP is solely responsible for this content.
The Canadian Press

author: world today news
title: EHC Thun’s Cup Semi-Final Loss to Basel: A Dream Shattered
text:
– EHC Thun’s final dream has shattered
The Bernese Oberlanders make up a 0-2 deficit against the higher-class Basel, but lose the cup semi-final game in a penalty shootout.
Published today at 10:34 p.m
Thun goal celebration after Fabian Boss’ goal.
Photo: Markus Grunder
Despite the defeat: A calendar year that (almost) couldn’t have been better came to an end for EHC Thun on Thursday. First, the Bernese Oberlanders made it to the playoff final in the MyHockey League (MHL) last season. Despite their incredible bad luck with injuries, they are once again doing well in the current championship. Accidents like the 5-0 loss at home against Frauenfeld can happen. And in the Swiss Cup, Thun knocked two higher-class teams, Bellinzona and the GCK Lions, out of the competition.
They will be rewarded for this during the festive season with the semi-final game against the strongest possible opponent remaining in this competition. The opponent is EHC Basel, the current leader of the Swiss League.
Puck throw-in by Hanspeter Latour
An interesting comparison between two teams that are at the top of their leagues and have one thing in common. Neither club wants to get promoted. Not this season. “We’re not ready for it yet. “But everything could look different in a year,” says Basel’s sports director Kevin Schläpfer before the game in Grabengut. The Swiss League could soon become an issue in Thun too. Maybe in a year too.
But celebrations can already be celebrated today. Just in the cup. Hanspeter Latour is present and opens the game with the symbolic puck throw-in. In 2004, as coach of Thun’s footballers, Latour defeated FC Basel 4-1 in a memorable game. Can the ice hockey team do the same 19 years later?
Suddenly Basel leads 2-0
In any case, the Basel team take the game and the opponent seriously. You know the qualities of EHC Thun. And he more than holds up for long stretches of the game. Basel is only stronger than the MHL club in the power play, at least for the time being.
The EHC Basel is in trouble: Thun is making life difficult for the higher class.
Photo: Markus Grunder
It is a situation of superiority that gives the guests the lead. The Canadian Jakub Stukel scores. Only 24 seconds have been played in the middle third. Around three turns of the hand, Basel extends its lead. Stukel can once again be celebrated as a goalscorer.
Thun catching up
Thun defends himself and looks for the next goal in the absence of head coach Daniel Steiner. Steiner is currently with the U17 national team at the
World Cup in Finland. Assistant coach Hans Bosshardt is on the boards in the Cup semi-finals.
Michael Bärtschi only hits the edge of the goal (38th). But then the disc is in. Fabian Boss brings hope back 1:13 minutes before the second half-time siren. Mathys Mojonnier finally equalizes (52nd). The majority of the 1,741 spectators are enthusiastic. Thun is close to 3:2. But there is an extension. Keeper Stephan Küenzi saves the home team from a penalty shootout. In this respect, only Nocola Christen is successful in the Bernese Oberland. Basel scores twice and, like Olten, who narrowly defeated Seewen, is in the cup final.

author: @wsfa12news
title: Strong solar flare seen in dazzling image on New Year’s Eve
text: Strong solar flare seen in dazzling image on New Year’s Eve (Gray News) - 2023 ended with an incredible light show from space. NASA’s Solar Dynamics Observatory [captured a spectacular image](https://blogs.nasa.gov/solarcycle25/2023/12/31/strong-solar-flare-erupts-from-sun-8/) of a strong solar flare erupting from the sun Sunday afternoon. The close-up image of the sun shows a mix of yellow, orange, brown and black colors. A bright white flash that appears on the left side of the photo is the solar flare, which peaked at 4:55 p.m. Eastern Standard Time on Sunday. NASA said the flare is classified as an X5.0 flare, with X-class being flares of the highest intensity. Solar flares are powerful bursts of energy made of extremely hot solar material. Flares and solar eruptions, while beautiful, can impact radio communications, electric power grids, navigation signals and even pose a risk to spacecraft and astronauts. The space agency said it constantly monitors the sun and space, studying solar activity, the solar atmosphere, particles and the Earth’s magnetic field. Copyright 2024 Gray Media Group, Inc. All rights reserved. CNN Newsource contributed to this report.
